      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • initializeGame

        public void initializeGame​(danogl.gui.ImageReader imageReader,
                           danogl.gui.SoundReader soundReader,
                           danogl.gui.UserInputListener inputListener,
                           danogl.gui.WindowController windowController)
        The method will be called once when a GameGUIComponent is created, and again after every invocation of windowController.resetGame().
        Overrides:
        initializeGame in class danogl.GameManager
        Parameters:
        imageReader - Contains a single method: readImage, which reads an image from disk. See its documentation for help.
        soundReader - Contains a single method: readSound, which reads a wav file from disk. See its documentation for help.
        inputListener - Contains a single method: isKeyPressed, which returns whether a given key is currently pressed by the user or not. See its documentation.
        windowController - Contains an array of helpful, self explanatory methods concerning the window.
        See Also:
        ImageReader, SoundReader, UserInputListener, WindowController

      • checkForGameEnd

        private void checkForGameEnd()

      • update

        public void update​(float deltaTime)
        Called once per frame. Any logic is put here. Rendering, on the other hand, should only be done within 'render'. Note that the time that passes between subsequent calls to this method is not constant.
        Overrides:
        update in class danogl.GameManager
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The time, in seconds, that passed since the last invocation of this method (i.e., since the last frame). This is useful for either accumulating the total time that passed since some event, or for physics integration (i.e., multiply this by the acceleration to get an estimate of the added velocity or by the velocity to get an estimate of the difference in position).
